definition: frost forming a pattern on a surface/rime
frost/white powder or cream spread over a surface/frosting/(skin) cream
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: The intricate patterns produced by frost, as on a windowpane.
sentences.chinese: 霜花霜凍形成如在玻璃窗上的複雜圖案。

sentences.english: The windows are filled with frost.
The single large window was patterned with frost.
sentences.chinese: 單扇大玻璃窗上結着霜花。

sentences.english: Different composition of frosting machine would lead to different frosted effect.
sentences.chinese: 並就不同的霜花機整機組成，闡述了霜花效果的差異。

sentences.english: Different composition of frosting machine would lead to different frosted effect.
sentences.chinese: 並就不同的霜花機整機組成，闡述了霜花效果的差異。

sentences.english: Frost has congealed on the lip and forbidden the curiosity.
sentences.chinese: 脣邊凝結的霜花阻去了好奇。

definition: autumn frost/fig. white hair as sign of old age
to float down/to fall gently (snowflakes, leaves etc)
snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
